review: At first, I thought I would never use this as I have a PS3 that serves as my media center for all my streaming services: Netflix, Hulu, etc. However once I started using it, it's hard to go back to the PS3. I initially bought one of these right after they released and it has only gotten better. My wife and I now use it to cast Netflix, Hulu, WatchESPN, HBOGo, Google Play Movies and Music, YouTube, Twitch, PocketCasts (for Podcasts), Chrome browser windows, Ultraviolet movies via Flixter/Vudu, etc. It's so easy to use. Perhaps the coolest use is that when visiting friends and family that own Chromecasts, I can simply use my phone that I always carry with me to stream anything from my cloud services that support Chromecast without having to carry physical media around! Additionally, more and more apps keep adding support. The biggest name video provider not supporting Chromecast is currently Amazon, and it's unlikely they will release Chromecast support for their apps since they came out with the Fire TV and Fire TV stick (although in a surprise move they recently released an Amazon Video app for Android Phones, so it COULD happen one day). So if you're invested in Prime Movies, this probably isn't the choice for you. For just about anything else, however, it's golden.
